text: Hi <@U01QSKYD4DU>, can you be more explicit about the computation you need to do? As David mentioned, our library LazySets can be used for polyhedral approximations of convex bodies. About Bernstein approximations, we have a package (check BersteinExpansions.jl in JuliaReach) but needs much more work. In particular the thesis cited in the README will give convex approximations of function ranges, if that's the kind of stuff you are asking.

text:
<@U01QSKYD4DU> Interesting problem. We do a similar thing in design under uncertainty, using Reliability based design optimisation (reducing the probability of your constraint being violated). Unfortunately we don’t yet have an integrated way to do this in Julia in N-dimensions.

c, a and b are vectors right?

If so, the inside of your constraint a^{\top}(x+\xi) <= b is the cdf of a multivariate gaussian. We can do this in 1D using Distributions.jl, or 2D using PBA. We’re working on extending this to N-D at the moment.

text: If you have an unknown probability distribution for \xi, you could use ProbabilityBoundsAnalysis.jl. In which case you would have a probability interval for your chance constraint. You could then reduce the upper bound of this interval in your optimisation problem
